meanings.definition: To make less stiff or rigid.
meanings.sent1: Gentle stretching exercises can help unstiffen your muscles.
meanings.sent2: After a few minutes of movement, the old door unstiffens and opens easily.
meanings.sent3: The yoga instructor joked that downward dog pose would unstiffen even the rustiest joints.
meanings.sent4: A warm bath can work wonders to unstiffen your body after a long day.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays seemed to magically unstiffen the frozen ground, allowing the flowers to bloom.

meanings.definition: To become less stiff or rigid.
meanings.sent1: As the ice melted, the frozen lake slowly unstiffened and became fluid again.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the old leather chair unstiffens and becomes more comfortable to sit in.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics never failed to unstiffen the serious atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent4: The music seemed to unstiffen the crowd, getting everyone to dance and let loose.
meanings.sent5: The laughter of children has a magical ability to unstiffen even the grumpiest of adults.
